name: Nanosecond
intro: High-precision time unit, suitable for measuring the time of chip operations, network latency, and quantum experiments.

name: Microsecond
intro: Precision time unit, adapted for measuring the response of sensors, industrial control, and high-frequency trading time.

name: Millisecond
intro: Common high-precision unit, adapted for measuring program response, audio sampling, and electronic device latency.

name: Second
intro: The international benchmark unit of time, defined as the transition period of cesium-133 atoms, the core of all time measurements.

name: Minute
intro: Daily time unit, adapted for measuring the duration of meetings, cooking, sports, and short videos.

name: Hour
intro: Core daily time unit, the mainstream measurement standard for work, study, travel, and film/television duration.

name: Day
intro: Natural time unit, based on the Earth's rotation period, the core standard for schedules, construction periods, and logistics timeliness.

name: Week
intro: Social work-rest unit, adapted for measuring work schedules, course arrangements, and project cycles.

name: Month (Average)
intro: Calendar unit, based on the lunar phase/revolution period, the core standard for bills, salaries, and repayment cycles.

name: Year
intro: Core calendar unit, based on the Earth's revolution period, the core standard for age, contracts, and financial cycles.

name: Decade
intro: Long-cycle time unit, adapted for describing historical stages, industry development, and population statistics time.

name: Century
intro: Ultra-long cycle unit, adapted for describing historical epochs, civilization development, and geological age time.
